byline.original: By DAVID BARSTOW and SUHASINI RAJ

abstract: Protest rally organized by Hardik Patel in Ahmedabad, India, to challenge country's quota system regarding caste stuns political elite, particularly those of Prime Min Narendra Modi's inner circle; more than 500,000 people attend rally, almost all of them members of caste whose support Modi has relied upon to triumph in elections; Patel has called for inclusion of his relatively affluent caste in quota system, which would effectively dismantle it.
lead_paragraph: Resentment has gelled into opposition to India’s version of affirmative action, a system of strict quotas that reserves nearly half of jobs for those from disadvantaged castes or tribes.

headline.main: Caste Quotas in India Come Under Attack
headline.print_headline: Caste Quotas in India Come Under Attack

snippet: Resentment has gelled into opposition to India’s version of affirmative action, a system of strict quotas that reserves nearly half of jobs for those from disadvantaged castes or tribes.
